Topic.Title: Amazon Seller Central Crashes..

Message.Msg: Amazon misses out on millions of sales this weekend as Seller Central Crashed and sellers were not able to fulfill their orders. Upset customers, seller and buyers, crashed the computer system at the call center with all their calls. The sellers were not able to reach seller support directly and had to call regular customer support to be transferred, call wait time reached well over 10 minutes. Over 10 minutes for a company that answers the phone within 1 minute even during the holiday season. When you got thru all they would say is that their computer is being upgraded( code word for crashed) and they can not view your account. All seller support would say is "we are aware of the problem... it has been happening all day...working hard to fix it as soon as possible."

Topic.Title: Techstrategy I suggest you map the directional of oil right over an AMZN chart the last week and might get enlightened

Message.Msg: NASD: I'm the one who pointed out over a year ago the inverse correlation between oil prices and Amazon's net income... That the buildout was a belated attempt to improve its inferior cost structure in a world of inexorably increasing oil prices. So, I understand the impact of oil prices better than you and most that cover this stock. But, one has to dig a little deeper to understand WHY oil prices are falling. It relates to the state of the consumer. A weakening consumer simply isn't good for Amazon. In fact, it is much worse for Amazon than the financial community and pumpers like yourself understand because none of you have a firm grip on activity based cost analysis to get at the true profit drivers. If the analysts were intellectually honest, this would have tanked long ago. Instead, they are helping friends dump #$%$ on faceless retail buyers on index funds. I suppose getting Vanguard's attention on the scam that is being pulled might create some institutional resistance to it., but otherwise, we'll have to see it all break down before the real SHTF... In short, your falling gas prices will not help because they are falling from demand destruction, not supply increase (despite what the media would like you to believe). The long term trajectory will be inexorably higher absent recessionary periods.

Topic.Title: techstrategy has proven to be nothing but a pompous, bloviating, pontificator of nonsnese trying to justify his losses in AMZN:

Message.Msg: Pompous is a matter of perspective. Idiot is not. Anyone who has read my posts over a year knows that I have been and will continue to be correct on the fundamentals. Analysts keep inventing new stories rather than trying to get to the root cause of the disappointments. I figured it out a year before you and them. That isn't being an idiot. It the pain of being so far ahead of you that I have to wait for the momentum ponzi players to run out of steam... Personally, I think Amazon was less than forthcoming about its financial position, known US and international tax issues and other what I believe to be material risks in its debt offering. I will make damn sure that the next time it tries to raise money, there is a clear fact base on the reasons for its lagging fundamental performance and the true leverage / risk involved. And, Amazon will have to tap the capital markets again in 2013 if it wants to maintain its rate of physical expansion.

Topic.Title: and by the way, Sybil's banning might not be censorship, but b/c of fraud

Message.Msg: I'm not concerned with an individual trader on a message board. If however, he has ties to fund, such as a behavioral algo fund involved in option scalping and his purpose was to illicit emotional responses where cognitive biases would override prudent investing, then I hope they would nail his tail to the wall. I got an email from him that they've totally blocked his IPs so he cannot use new aliases. I myself have had one device blocked and seem only to be able to access this from the computer that was prior hacked (and from which I have screencaptures of an AWS web address trying to access it remotely....), so I do not doubt that has happened to him. It does seem that some who use there message boards have institutional support (certain posters magically track lots of information on lots of people, which can only make economic sense if the information is used at an institutional level) to play the pumper/basher game. If so, those people and institutions should get whacked. Hard... But, my target is much higher level. The AAPL/AMZN trade is a perfect case study in our broken markets. The intellectual dishonesty amongst almost all in the financial sector on what is really happening here is profound. I will stay with this as long as it takes to do a Bethany McLean style expose... If that ends up being 2014, so be it...

Topic.Title: Fed feeders

Message.Msg: 2/27 was just like 11/26... Amazon ready started to lose momentum and break down, so they had to accelerate the selling of AAPL to paint the tape for Amazon and knockout AAPL longs in the process. They are just delaying Amazon's massive drop. It cannot be prevented. Once: as to why I think it will reverse, folks will have to be insane to be short AAPL or long AMZN at these relative valuations heading into the next earnings call. A fair relative valuation on fundamentals would be closer to 10:1. The relative enterprise value is about 2:1 right now. There aren't many opportunities to meaningfully reduce risk and increase upside simultaneously. Right now, they are pushing to capitulation in both directions. Once it happens, the fall here will be epic....
